name: Radio : The Years Before TV Online Quiz | Radio | 10 Questions

questions.text: L.A. (Speed) Riggs was on radio's 'Your Hit Parade'. What did he do?
questions.explanation:
Auctioneer.

	The show was on Saturday nights and it saved the top three songs for the end of the show. It was sponsored by Lucky Strikes and more than 50 different singers appeared on the radio version.

questions.text: What was the name of the Lone Ranger's nephew?
questions.explanation:
Dan Reed.

	Dan was played by James Lipton on radio. He was supposed to be the father of Britt reid who later became the Green Hornet.

questions.text: Who was the longtime announcer on the 'Fibber McGee and Molly' show?
questions.explanation:
Harlow Wilcox.

	He was actually considered part of the show. It was sponsored for most of its life by Johnson's Wax. Their famous address was 79 Wistful Vista.

questions.text: The 'Straight Shooters Club' for young listeners was associated with what cowboy?
questions.explanation:
Tom Mix.

	Radio's Tom Mix had little similarity with the actual Tom Mix. The show was sponsored by Ralsto Purina and debuted in September 1933. The real Tom Mix died in an auto accident in 1940.

questions.text: 'A box of Mars bars and two tickets to next week's production' were the prizes given to losing contestants on what quiz show?
questions.explanation:
Dr. I.Q.

	Dr. IQ was "MCed" by a man who would drop jingling silver dollars into the hands of winners. A sound that could be heard by every radio listener.

questions.text: What was the name of Henry Aldrich's sister?
questions.explanation:
Mary.

	Ezra Stone starred as the first Henry. It was on for 13 years and rated in the top 10 with Jack Benny, Bob Hope and Fibber McGee and Molly.

questions.text: What was the comedy singing group on the 'Jack Benny Program' called?
questions.explanation:
The Sportsmen.

	The Lucky Strike commercials done by  the group were often done as popular songs somehow related to the events in the program.

questions.text: Who led the orchestra on the 'Bell Telephone Hour'?
questions.explanation:
Donald Voorhees.

	"The Bell Telephone Hour" was on radio for 19 years before moving to television in 1959. Voorhees was the conductor for thr total radio and TV time.He composed "The Bell Waltz".

questions.text: Name the food product that sponsored Jack Benny on radio.
questions.explanation:
Jell-O.

	Don Wilson was the announcer, Mary Livingstone his wife, Rochester, played be Eddie Anderson, his valet and Phil Harris the bandleader.

questions.text: Who portrayed Hopalong Cassidy on radio?
questions.explanation:
William Boyd.

	He played in 66 motion picture features. He had mainly three  sidekicks, Gabby Hayes, Andy Clyde and later Edward Buchanan. His horse was named Topper.
